page.title: 01GAZETTEER - REIGATE/REDHILL
page.content: Reigate & Redhill have a{population {of 55,000;}2 distinct shopping centres several public open spaces including the North Downs, & much high class housing. The estimated product of penny rate for 85/86 is Â£192,700. This{prosperous area}has regular train services to London, Brighton, Tonbridge & Reading, and a good road net-work. Gatwick airport is 5 miles south. The rapid growth of offices & light industry has resulted in low unemployment - 5.1% - in the area. {Reigate}has several interesting features - the Old Town Hall (1728), the Priory, the Baron's Cave & the medieval church of St.Mary Magdalene. {Redhill}was built after the coming of the railway. The town centre is being re-developed & a new shopping/ civic centre opens later this year. There is an excellent sports centre.
